content: Case studies of the urban renaissance in the South East have been published by the DTLR. The report examines 30 case studies from the South East region.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p a span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p a span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Living Places (case studies of the urban renaissance in the South East) was jointly commissioned in 2000 by the Government Office for the South East (GOSE) and the then Department of the Environment, Transport and the Regions (DETR).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The aims of the research were to:

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Explain why urban renaissance is important for theSouthEast, and where it is likely to be most relevant

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Show how different places in the South East are alreadyimplementing various aspects of urban renaissance

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The Living Places report is based on a comprehensive review of recent research and policy guidance on issues relating to urban renaissance and on 30 case studies of what is already being done in this field.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The great majority of the case studies are drawn from the South East Region itself, although a few come from other parts of the old ROSE area (and exclude Greater London which as a world city is on a very different scale from anywhere else in the South East).

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The case studies have been drawn from a range of different types and sizes of towns, and from different parts of the region, so that more people will be able to find situations that they can identify with. One case study and one examplehowever (both focusing on public transport) are drawn from mainland Europe. The Research Review and the case studies are contained in a separate Technical Report published on DLTR website.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p b span
content: For more information contact Christopher Cadell in our London Office

content: URBED (Urban and Economic Development Group) is a leading independent research and consultancy firm specialising in the fields of urban regeneration, local economic development, sustainability and urban design.
